meanings.definition: The act of removing glamour or charm from something.
meanings.sent1: The deglamorization of the old mansion revealed its true worn-out state.
meanings.sent2: The deglamorization of the movie star's life showed the reality behind the fame.
meanings.sent3: The deglamorization of the fairy tale characters made them seem like regular people.
meanings.sent4: The deglamorization of the city's nightlife exposed its gritty underbelly.
meanings.sent5: The deglamorization of the fashion industry highlighted the hard work behind the scenes.

meanings.definition: To make something seem less attractive or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The harsh lighting in the store deglamorized the expensive jewelry.
meanings.sent2: The documentary deglamorized the fast-paced life of a celebrity.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes deglamorized the idea of perfect relationships.
meanings.sent4: The rainy weather deglamorized the beach vacation experience.
meanings.sent5: The plain packaging deglamorized the luxury product.
